snippet: The corn farming, meat production and biofuel industries are sparring over the Agriculture Department’s ethanol quota as a drought ravages corn crops.
abstract: Corn farming, meat production and biofuel industries are sparring over the Agriculture Department’s ethanol quota as a drought ravages corn crops; at issue is whether to suspend a five-year-old federal mandate requiring more ethanol in gasoline each year, a policy that has diverted almost half of the domestic corn supply from animal feedlots to ethanol refineries, driven up corn prices and plantings and created a desperate competition for corn.
lead_paragraph: The corn farming, meat production and biofuel industries are sparring over the Agriculture Department’s ethanol quota as a drought ravages corn crops.

headline.seo: Ethanol Quota Debated by Corn Farmers and Meat Industry
headline.main: In Drought, a Debate Over Quota for Ethanol
headline.print_headline: In Drought, A Debate Over Quota For Ethanol
